description: From Latin blasphēmus (“blaspheming”), from Ancient Greek βλάσφημος (blásphēmos, “uttering ill-omened words”), possibly from βλάξ (bláx, “idiot”) + φήμη (phḗmē, “oracle”).

adjectives.description: blasphemous (comparative more blasphemous, superlative most blasphemous)

entries.meaning: Lacking piety or respect for the sacred. Resembling blasphemy.
examples: His taking the name of God in vain was considered blasphemous.
